title: Diff. eq. with slope field and tang. line approx.

content.question:
Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4306@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(0) = 1. The function f is defined for all real numbers.

(a) A portion of the slope field of the differential equation is given below. Sketch the solution curve through the point (0,1).

frqParts.text:
Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>y</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4306@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = f(x) be the particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(0) = 1. The function f is defined for all real numbers.

(a) A portion of the slope field of the differential equation is given below. Sketch the solution curve through the point (0,1).
(b) Write an equation for the line tangent to the solution curve in part (a) at the point (0,1). Use the equation to approximate f(0.2).
(c) Find y = f(x), the particular solution to the differential equation with the initial condition f(0) = 1.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
